title: Bitcoin SV
author: Bitcoin SV
created_time: December 24, 2022, 11:33:04 AMLast edit: December 24, 2022, 06:38:28 PM by Bitcoin SV
content: Hey, Changpeng Zhao - you an accomplice of FTX scam!Remember this photo?CZ, if you not accomplice of FTX scam then why that scamish FTT Token still listed at Binance?https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/ftx-tokenWhere's the justice? Why was our harmless coin has been delisted from Binance, but this scam FTT token still not delisted on binance?WHY?

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Why it's a self moderated thread?

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: I mean, you want to discuss why FTT currency is still listed on Binance or why your currency was removed from the platform? In either case, the idea that the administrators of the two platforms were involved in the spam that occurred cannot be confirmed, although it is possible that each of them was a partial contributor to the collapse of FTX.Regarding your currency, why is it difficult for you to understand that not everyone recognized it and many consider it to be a confirmed scam, at the same time that it is accepted in many services and payment gateways.Note: It is not a good idea to create a self-moderated topic because it will not be comfortable for members to write their thoughts freely while they expect that you may delete it if you don't like it. This board does not contain much spam, with the exception of drama lovers from new accounts or tagged ones.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Since the start of FTX issues lot of exchange has restricted BNB withdrawal and delist FTT token from their trading platform but to my greatest surprised still seeing FTT token trading on Binance and this kept me wondering if actually his is a partner with FTX CEO naturally he should have restricted the withdrawal and deposit for FTT token to avoid further damage or lost.

comments.author: Bitcoin SV
comments.created_time: December 25, 2022, 06:38:36 AMLast edit: December 25, 2022, 06:55:25 AM by Bitcoin SV
comments.body: How is this possible?Scamish FTX has been closed. But token still aliveHOW?This is cheating users. The token still exists while the exchange turned into scam.CZ is violates the rules of exchanges trading. Scamish token of scamish exchange still not delisted. Token emission is impossible now due to FTX bankrupcy. That's why all the volumes are drawn

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Adbitco on December 24, 2022, 01:24:13 PMSince the start of FTX issues lot of exchange has restricted BNB withdrawal and delist FTT token from their trading platform but to my greatest surprised still seeing FTT token trading on Binance and this kept me wondering if actually his is a partner with FTX CEO naturally he should have restricted the withdrawal and deposit for FTT token to avoid further damage or lost.Same thought. Remember when Terra has been delisted by other platform during the early issues? Then thats the same cause its literally extend the trading on luna instead of preventing further losses on that token. Now its happening again on FTT wherein Binance still keeping the token for open trading which could broke others when this one go out of nuts.

The token still exists while the exchange turned into scam.CZ is violates the rules of exchanges trading. Scamish token of scamish exchange still not delisted. Maybe they are trying the "decentralized free marketÂ  trading" propaganda here while delisting the coins/tokens in all other pairs. Even Luna and SRM didnt get delisted against BUSD. Btw, its all upto us, if you hate it dont use it, simple. Oops, I see your scam BSV is not trading on binance anymore against any pair, cant get more upsetting lol.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin SV on December 24, 2022, 11:33:04 AMCZ, if you not accomplice of FTX scam then why that scamish FTT Token still listed at Binance?[/size][/b]From what I can see, FTT is still listed on other popular exchanges (Kucoin, Bybit, Huobi, Gate) too so you might address your question to them as well.Quote from: Edwardard on December 25, 2022, 08:03:00 AMBinance usually doesnt delist tokens in BUSD pairs.Just ~10 days ago they announced some BUSD trading par removals, so it wouldn't be out of ordinary to delist FTT/BUSD as well (which should have be done of course).Since Binance probably still has big portion of those 23 million FTT, no surprise that they kept it on their exchange, I didn't expect anything else from them.

comments.author: janggernaut
comments.body: Does CZ_binance has a bitcointalk account?

comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on December 25, 2022, 08:52:18 AMJust ~10 days ago they announced some BUSD trading par removals, so it wouldn't be out of ordinary to delist FTT/BUSD as well (which should have be done of course).Oh, you're right, they did delist some coins. Not sure what are they upto.QuoteSince Binance probably still has big portion of those 23 million FTT, no surprise that they kept it on their exchange, I didn't expect anything else from them.Could be, they held luna as well hence its still trading as LUNC/BUSD. Quote from: janggernaut on December 25, 2022, 11:46:54 AMDoes CZ_binance has a bitcointalk account?He probably has one. Assuming by his recent retweet about satoshi's activity on the forum, he is aware about bitcointalk.

comments.author: coupable
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin SV on December 25, 2022, 06:38:36 AMCZ is violates the rules of exchanges trading. Scamish token of scamish exchange still not delisted. Token emission is impossible now due to FTX bankrupcy. That's why all the volumes are drawnBy the way, Binance is not the only one that still lists FTT coin for trading. There are other large platforms where users can still trade FTT against major currencies. The reason for this may be because the platform has a huge balance of that currency and is trying to get rid of as much as possible. And if you notice, you will find that there are actually sales taking place even after the collapse of FTX. At least we are sure that Binance has a large amount that it acquired when the price of 1 FTT was equal to or more than $22.According to the TOS of those platforms, there is nothing to prevent them from keeping dead currencies or to force them to stop trading tokens belong to scam project.Anyways, you can write to them yourself and ask for an explanation. I doubt you will receive an answer.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin SV on December 26, 2022, 05:10:43 PMSomebody post this to the Zhao's twitterBeing realistic, it would take more than posting this to Binance or CZ twitter to bring awareness of your accusations of scam. Besides, last time I checked, CZ's Twitter account is set for only to get replies from people whom he follows.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: I on-looked FTX rise and fall. I saw a lot of positive (at the time) news between CZ and SBF. I have expressed that I find it extremely hard to believe that CZ was unaware of the wrong-doings in other threads, and that CZ would have skeletons in his closet that no one have seen yet. I hope that one day he is exposed and I am posting here in case some news arises. Centralized exchanges need to be boycotted, as do their CEOs, who all negatively effect the industry for profit in my opinion.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: UserU on December 26, 2022, 03:18:10 PMAlthough I doubt he'd ever come across this subforum, let alone create an account and post here since he's likely too busy with other tasks.While chances of him being currently active on bitcointalk are slim to none (and so are the chances of him ever seeing this topic) I think that he most likely came across this forum sometimes in the past, and maybe even created an account. Keep in mind that he is in crypto since 2013, situation back then was much different, there weren't many places where you could talk about bitcoin and bitcointalk was in the center of it all. comments.author: DooMAD
comments.body: "Scumbags in glass houses shouldn't throw stones."User 'Bitcoin SV' is an accomplice of the faketoshi scam.Â  They're more than happy to take wealth from unsuspecting victims.Â  Hardly in a position to judge.That, and it honestly wouldn't surprise me if they're just being pissy because their crapcoin got delisted from Binance.
